Package Game

Class Questions

java.lang.Object
Game.Questions
public class Questions extends Object
This class handles the quiz after the stories are finished.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Questions(Player player)
    When this class is created, the right questions for the player, according to their plan are chosen and added to the myQuestions.

    Boolean

  • Constructor Details

    • Questions

      public Questions(Player player) throws InterruptedException
      When this class is created, the right questions for the player, according to their plan are chosen and added to the myQuestions. The corresponding list of possible answers and a correct answer are added to the myOptions and myCorrectAnswers Then, it then creates QuestionsGUI class which shows the quiz for the player to play. It uses a Builder design pattern in QuestionsBuilder class, which builds the GUI with the questions. Then after the player confirms their choices in the QuestionsGUI class, it evaluates each answer and adds 5 points for each correct answer by calling Player.addPoints(int) method.
      Parameters:
      player - the player
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

  • Method Details

    • ifDone

      public Boolean ifDone() throws InterruptedException
      This is a method that uses Waiter class to wait until everything in this class is done.
      Returns:
      the boolean value of done
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
